newsitem.title: LATVIA: EARLY AFTERNOON RADIO HEADLINES - APRIL 16.
newsitem.headline: EARLY AFTERNOON RADIO HEADLINES - APRIL 16.

text.p: These are the main headlines reported reported by Radio Latvia on Wednesday in the early afternoon. Reuters has not verified these reports and cannot vouch for their accuracy.
- A policeman in Riga has shot dead a student of the police academy.
- The government parties agreed to speed up the ratification by the parliament of the Geneva convention on refugees.
- Agreements on visa-free travel with Sweden and Finland have already been initailed, Foreign minister Valdis Birkavs told the factions.
- A Latvian day is being held today at the Hannover trade fair with 21 companies participating.
